lustrum.definition:
1) a period of five years
2) a ceremonial purification of the Roman population every five years following the census

lute.definition:
1) a substance for packing a joint or coating a porous surface to make it impervious to gas or liquid
2) chordophone consisting of a plucked instrument having a pear-shaped body, a usually bent neck, and a fretted fingerboard

luteal.definition: of or relating to the corpus luteum

lutetium.definition: a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group; usually occurs in association with yttrium

luther.definition: German theologian who led the Reformation; believed that salvation is granted on the basis of faith rather than deeds (1483-1546)

lutheran.definition:
1) of or pertaining to Martin Luther or his teachings
2) of or pertaining to or characteristic of the branch of the Protestant Church adhering to the views of Luther

examples.en: the Lutheran doctrine of justification by faith alone

lutheranism.definition: teachings of Martin Luther emphasizing the cardinal doctrine of justification by faith alone

luthier.definition: a craftsman who makes stringed instruments (as lutes or guitars or violins)

lutyens.definition: English architect who planned the city of New Delhi (1869-1944)

lutist.definition: a musician who plays the lute

lutjanus.definition: type genus of the Lutjanidae: snappers

lutra.definition: in some classifications considered a genus of the subfamily Lutrinae

lutrinae.definition: subdivision not used in some classifications: otters

lux.definition: a unit of illumination equal to 1 lumen per square meter; 0.0929 foot candle

luxation.definition: displacement or misalignment of a joint or organ

luxembourg.definition: a grand duchy (a constitutional monarchy) landlocked in northwestern Europe between France and Belgium and Germany; an international financial center

luxemburger.definition:
1) of or relating to the capital city of Luxemburg
2) of or relating to or characteristic of the grand duchy of Luxemburg or its people

luxor.definition: a city in central Egypt on the east bank of the Nile that is a center for visitors to the ruins of and around Thebes

luxury.definition:
1) something that is an indulgence rather than a necessity
3) wealth as evidenced by sumptuous living

luxuriance.definition: the property of being lush and abundant and a pleasure to the senses

luxuriantly.definition:
1) in an abundant and luxuriant manner
2) in an elegantly luxuriant way

examples.en: whiskers grew luxuriantly from his ample jowls
this suave, culture-loving and luxuriantly good-looking M.P.represents the car-workers of Coventry

luxuriate.definition:
1) become extravagant; indulge (oneself) luxuriously
3) thrive profusely or flourish extensively

luxuriation.definition: an activity that affords excessive pleasure and enjoyment

examples.en: she sprawled out luxuriously on the sofa

luzon.definition: the main island of the Philippines
